sense.def:
To help someone
pomeni nekomu nekaj olajšati, na primer tako, da opravimo nekaj njegovega dela ali mu damo nasvet ali denar.

seg.quote: Something went wrong with his machine so I helped him fix it.
The courier helped everyone out of the coach.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
helps
, nam olajša, da nekaj dobimo, storimo ali prenesemo.

seg.quote: I've got 40 pence, will that help?
Good weather helped the clean-up operations on the East Coast.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
helps to achieve a particular result
, je ena od stvari, ki skupaj dosežejo določen učinek.

seg.quote: One of the things that can help to keep prices down is high productivity.
Having a job helps keep them off the streets.

sense.def:
To help oneself
pomeni vzeti nekaj hrane ali pijače.

seg.quote: Mr Stokes helped himself to some more rum.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo
can't help the way one feels or the way one behaves
, ne more spremeniti ali preprečiti svojih občutkov ali vedenja.

seg.quote: You can't help who you fall in love with.
I can't help feeling that it was a mistake to let him go.

sense.def:
To give help to someone
pomeni nekomu pomagati.

seg.quote: The organization gives help to single women.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj
is a help
, nam pomaga nekaj narediti.

seg.quote: He was a great help with some of the problems.

sense.def:
Kadar je nekaj
of help
, stvari naredi lažje ali boljše.

seg.quote: Having a sober mind around might prove to be of some help.

sense.def:
‘Help!’
vzkliknemo, kadar smo v nevarnosti, da bi pritegnili pozornost.

To help out
ali
to help someone out
pomeni nekomu pomagati tako, da zanj opravimo neko delo ali mu posodimo denar.

cit.quote: pomagati komu prebroditi težave, podpreti koga
